interface.name: zwp_primary_selection_device_manager_v1
interface.description: The primary selection device manager is a singleton global object that provides access to the primary selection. It allows to create zwp_primary_selection_source_v1 objects, as well as retrieving the per-seat zwp_primary_selection_device_v1 to interact with the primary selection.

request.name: create_source

description.summary: create a new primary selection source

request.description: Create a new primary selection source.

request.name: get_device

description.summary: create a new primary selection device

request.description: Create a new data device for a given seat.

request.name: destroy

description.summary: destroy the primary selection device manager

request.description: Destroy the primary selection device manager.

description.summary: offer to replace the contents of the primary selection

request.name: set_selection
request.description:
Replaces the current selection. The previous owner of the primary selection will receive a zwp_primary_selection_source_v1.cancelled event.
To unset the selection, set the source to NULL.

event.name: data_offer
event.description: Introduces a new zwp_primary_selection_offer_v1 object that may be used to receive the current primary selection. Immediately following this event, the new data_offer object will send zwp_primary_selection_offer_v1.offer events to describe the offered mime types.

event.name: selection
event.description:
This event is sent after the zwp_primary_selection_offer_v1 events have been sent to introduce a new primary selection.
The data_offer is valid until a new data_offer or NULL is received or until the client loses keyboard focus.

interface.name: zwp_primary_selection_offer_v1

description.summary: offer to transfer primary selection contents

interface.description: A zwp_primary_selection_offer_v1 represents an offer to transfer the contents of the primary selection clipboard to the client.

request.name: receive

description.summary: request that the data is transferred

request.description:
To transfer the offered data, the client issues this request and indicates the mime type it wants to receive. The transfer happens through the passed file descriptor (typically created with the pipe system call). The source client writes the data in the mime type representation requested and then closes the file descriptor.
The receiving client reads from the read end of the pipe until EOF and then closes its end, at which point the transfer is complete.

event.name: offer
event.description: Sent immediately after creating the zwp_primary_selection_offer_v1 object. One event per offered mime type.

interface.name: zwp_primary_selection_source_v1

description.summary: offer to replace the contents of the primary selection

interface.description: The source side of a zwp_primary_selection_offer_v1, it provides a way to describe the offered data and respond to requests to transfer the requested contents of the primary selection clipboard.

request.name: offer
request.description: This request adds a mime type to the set of mime types advertised to targets. Can be called several times to offer multiple types.

event.name: send
event.description: Request for the current primary selection contents from the client. Send the specified mime type over the passed file descriptor, then close it.

event.name: cancelled

description.summary: request for primary selection contents was cancelled

event.description: This primary selection source is no longer valid. The client should clean up and destroy this primary selection source.
